messages.message:
For folks looking to upgrade their git experience, check out https://graphite.dev/docs/cli-quick-start, if you haven't already. I've been using this for a while now and just love the simplicity and features it provides. Stacking is probably the most powerful feature
Summarizing some commands to give you some idea.
```gt branch create "<branch_name> -a -m "<message>"   // Create new branch with current changes on top of current branch.   
gt modify -cam "<message>"     // Create a new commit on the branch.
gt modify -a                  // Append to last commit. 

// Stacking
gt branch create "branch1" 
gt branch create "branch2"

branch2
|
branch1        
|
master   

gt submit  // Creates 2 pull requests for 2 branches.
gt sync   // Pull latest changes from master and automatically rebases all above branches (via gt stack restack).```
hmm is this not just like the github cli?whats the difference?
I think they intend to simplify lot of the workflows. You can check their features section for details.
For the stacked PRs, what does the PR for branch2 look like? As in, does it include changes for branch1 as well or just branch2?
Itâ€™s based off branch1 and will have only new changes in branch2 compared to branch1 shown in the PR.
